column5: What were they thinking ? No matter how they spin it, they were chasing a moose and lead rider got very close. Could have turned out very bad for the sledders.  Why they chose to follow vs stop and cut the engine and let moose go on ahead is beyond me. One rule I try to follow is never expect wildlife to do anything predictable.

There's a good reason they follow instead of stopping and waiting. You stop and the moose could just stand there for hours. You follow and 99% of the time the moose will veer off the trail. This moose was a 1%er.
oops, thanks Gerritt. I looked for a thread but didn't go back far enuff  can a mod delete this one ?
